fgeo.tool 0.0.0.9004
  • Reference
  • fgeo

Import multiple .rdata files from a directory into a dataframe.

Source: R/rdata_df.R
rdata_df.Rd

This is shortcut for list_df(rdata_list(x)) with the additional ability to read exclusively .rdata files containing a specific string. It is designed to expect that all .rdata files contain dataframes with the same names -- as is the case for multiple ForestGEO censuses delivered by the database. Notice that function name have the format input_output, i.e. rdata_df.

rdata_df(path_dir, match = NULL, .id = NULL)

Arguments

path_dir

String; the path to a directory containing the files to read (all must be of appropriate format; see examples).
match

If not NULL a sting to match specific .rdata file-names (excluding the extension).
.id

If not NULL a variable with this name will be created to inform the source file.

Value

A dataframe.

See also

Other general functions to import data: dir_list, read_with, xlsheets_list

Examples

path_dir <- tool_example("rdata")
dir(path_dir)
#> [1] "tree5.RData" "tree6.RData"

rdata_df(path_dir)
#> # A tibble: 2,000 x 19
#>    treeID stemID tag   StemTag sp    quadrat    gx    gy MeasureID CensusID
#>     <int>  <int> <chr> <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <int>    <int>
#>  1    104    143 10009 10009   DACE~ 113      10.3  245.    439947        5
#>  2    119    158 1001~ 100104  MYRS~ 1021    183.   410.    466597        5
#>  3    180    225 1001~ 100174  CASA~ 921     165.   410.    466623        5
#>  4    602    736 1006~ 100649  GUAG~ 821     149.   414.    466727        5
#>  5    631    775 10069 10069   PREM~ 213      38.3  245.    439989        5
#>  6    647    793 1007~ 100708  SCHM~ 821     143.   411.    466743        5
#>  7   1086   1339 10122 10122   DRYG~ 413      68.9  253.    440021        5
#>  8   1144   1410 1012~ 101285  SCHM~ 920     161.   395.    466889        5
#>  9   1168   1438 10131 10131   DACE~ 413      70.6  252.    440031        5
#> 10   1380 114352 1015~ 149529  CASA~ 820     142.   386.    466957        5
#> # ... with 1,990 more rows, and 9 more variables: dbh <dbl>, pom <chr>,
#> #   hom <dbl>, ExactDate <date>, DFstatus <chr>, codes <chr>, nostems <dbl>,
#> #   status <chr>, date <dbl>

rdata_df(path_dir, match = "tree6")

#>    treeID stemID tag   StemTag sp    quadrat    gx    gy MeasureID CensusID

#> #   hom <dbl>, ExactDate <date>, DFstatus <chr>, codes <chr>, nostems <dbl>,
#> #   status <chr>, date <dbl>

dfm <- rdata_df(path_dir, match = "tree5|6", .id = "source")
dfm
#> # A tibble: 2,000 x 20
#>    source treeID stemID tag   StemTag sp    quadrat    gx    gy MeasureID
#>    <chr>   <int>  <int> <chr> <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <int>
